action.action-desc: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to remove the exclusion from medical assistance under the Medicaid program of items and services for patients in an institution for mental diseases, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Michelle Alyssa Go Act.

section.header: Removal of age exclusion from medical assistance of items and services for patients in an institution for mental diseases

subsection.text: Section 1905(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d(a)) is amended, in the first sentence, in the matter following paragraph (31)—

paragraph.text: by striking such term does not include— and all that follows through (A) any and inserting such term does not include any;
by striking ; or and inserting a period; and

subsection.header: Conforming amendments To permit medical assistance for IMD patients under 65 years of age
subsection.text: Title XIX of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a et seq.) is amended—

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking 65 years of age or older; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking 65 years of age or older; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (21) by striking 65 years of age or older;

paragraph.text: in section 1905(a)(14), by striking 65 years of age or over; and
in section 1919(e)(7)(B)(i)(I), by striking 65 years of age or older.

section.text: Section 1905(i) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d(i)) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: The term institution for mental diseases means a hospital, nursing facility, or other institution that—

paragraph.text: is primarily engaged in providing diagnosis, treatment, or care of persons with mental diseases, including medical attention, nursing care, and related services; and

meets nationally recognized, evidence-based standards for mental health programs (and, in the case of an institution for mental diseases that provides treatment for substance use disorders, meets nationally recognized, evidence-based standards for substance use disorder programs, such as the latest standards set forth by the American Society of Addiction Medicine), approved by the Secretary, including standards that establish the types of services offered, hours of clinical care, and staffing credentials for such an institution, and any other standards as the Secretary may require.

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act and shall apply to State plans beginning on such date.
